item.title: Making ProtonVPN Usable on Linux
item.description: Proton provides a GUI and a console application for Linux, but on 2022, it is nearly unusable. It consumes up to 2 GB of memory idled, drops connections and fails to reconnect unless the kill switch is deleted using nmcli. And the command line application has a bizarre dependency on nm-applet, which of course means it cannot be used on a headless machine. Brilliant. And it appears that ProtonVPN is not going to fix this. The solution is to use ProtonVPN with OpenVPN or Wireguard —or better yet, find a provider that cares about Linux. Fortunately, using OpenVPN is easy.
